thread.title: Alleged live images of a new, affordable BlackBerry phone pop up online
thread.title_full: Alleged live images of a new, affordable BlackBerry phone pop up online

title: Alleged live images of a new, affordable BlackBerry phone pop up online
text:
Alleged live images of a new, affordable BlackBerry phone pop up online Alleged live images of a new, affordable BlackBerry phone pop up online By March 1, 2017 “The upcoming BlackBerry smartphone is expected to be a 5.5-inch mid-range offering with Nougat” 
TCL, the Chinese brand that now oversees hardware and distribution of BlackBerry devices, launched the BlackBerry KEYone ( first impressions ) flagship at its pre-MWC event on February 25th. Now the company appears to be working on a mid-range smartphone, which has been leaked via a couple of live images. These images could be of the recently leaked BBC1001-1, which is expected to be launched in Indonesia in the coming weeks. 
The leaked images indicate that the BlackBerry BBC1001-1 will be a mid-range smartphone. The first image shows the front of the device with the BlackBerry logo sitting on the bottom bezel. The second photo shows the grey-coloured back panel of the handset, which houses the rear snapper on top, a large BlackBerry logo on the middle and a speaker grille at the bottom. 
As per the earlier reports, the leaked BlackBerry smartphone will carry a 5.5-inch HD display, and will be powered by a 1.4GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 SoC, mated to 4GB of RAM. It will come with 32GB of internal storage, dual-SIM slots, Android Nougat and a 3,000mAh battery. There’s no word if this phone will be launched in other markets like India.
